TopicTitle: My 100th Hour Of KSP - A small celebration package

Articles.Content:
Just recently, I hit my 100th hour of Kerbal Space Program.

Excited by this, I decided to assemble a little gift package. Here it is:

http://www./folder/7ncn708dbhv93/KSPACK

I couldn't think of much. The pack contains:

  • My Minmush I launch vehicle with attached Minmus lander, easily capable of reaching a suborbital trajectory over both of Kerbin's moons using only its second stage
  • My ROV11 Explosivity II rover and lander-crane (recommended for Munar use only, but can most likely land on atmospheric bodies such as Duna and, with added parachutes, Eve)
  • My KSP flag, assembled from a screenshot and the KSP logo

It's quite small, and I guess it'll help newer players the most. I was just aiming to give something to the community in return for being the backbone of the game I have played for 100 hours.
Well, Congradulations! -looks at your ribbon- you gotta land on duna ._.
Where do these ribbons come from anyways?

Where do these ribbons come from anyways?

http://ribbons.cgagnier.ca/

Congrats on your 100th hour!

146 hours here and not a single kerbal landed safely on the mun..I did crash into it on accident with a time warp glitch with my first kerbal to land there..I was heartbroken , but I have built a 800 part inter-planetary ship in Kerbin orbit I just have to work up the courage to start it's main engines....

Lots of probes and small landers abound though xD

He is showing that he's played 100 hours of KSP via Steam.

I didn't get anything from Steam when I reached the 100 mark, but when I hit 300 I got some virtual game cards. Sadly, when I hit 500, I didn't get anything extra.

Thanks for the gift package!

Ribbons? Is that part of belonging to a group?

Edited August 14, 2013 by Dispatcher
Asking about ribbons.
Thanks for the package my friend and congratulations on your 100th hour, and may you have 100 more, and then 100 more! lol

Ribbons? Is that part of belonging to a group?

Nah, it's just a way for anyone who plays KSP to show off their achievements in shorthand. Back in 0.17 when planets first got added, the number of achievements a given player could accomplish skyrocketed, and it wasn't long before someone devised an image-based "ribbons" system to show off what you've done on and around various planets in the game. Technically ribbons predate even that; they first started showing up around the time the Mun was added in 0.12 in fact.
I think you can click on the ribbon set in a person's signature and it goes to the thread about it.
Wow... 111 hours here and still going nowhere. Keep it up man! May your horizons expand ever wider.
